title: Premier Insurance Overview for NCE Members
summary: This page introduces Premier's Group Hospital Fixed Indemnity and Group Accident Insurance, underwritten by United States Fire Insurance Company. The insurance plans are offered exclusively to NCE members.

title: Group Hospital Fixed Indemnity and Group Accident Insurance Plans
summary: This page details various fixed indemnity and group accident insurance plans, outlining the benefits and coverage amounts for different plans labeled as 100 Plan, 200A Plan, 200+ Plan, 300 Plan, 500 Plan, 750 Plan, 1000 Plan, and 1000+ Plan. It includes specific benefit categories such as daily hospital confinement, emergency room visits, surgeries, diagnostic tests, and anesthesia. The page also mentions accidental death coverage and hospital admission benefits. The benefits vary by plan and are subject to certain conditions, including waiting periods for sickness.

title: Group Hospital Fixed Indemnity Benefit Details
summary: This page provides detailed descriptions of various hospital-related benefits under a fixed indemnity policy. It outlines the conditions and payment details for several benefits: Hospital Admission Benefit, Daily Hospital Confinement Benefit, Daily Intensive Care/Coronary Care Unit Benefit, Daily Inpatient Surgery Benefit, Daily Inpatient Surgery Anesthesia Benefit, and Daily Emergency Room Visits Benefit for Sickness and Injury. Each section specifies the conditions under which benefits are paid, such as medically necessary hospital stays, ICU confinements, surgeries, and emergency room visits. The document also notes the limitations and conditions for these benefits.

title: Group Hospital Fixed Indemnity Description of Benefits
summary: The page outlines various benefits under a group hospital fixed indemnity plan. It includes details on daily outpatient surgery benefits, specifying that surgeries must be medically necessary and performed in specific facilities like hospitals or ambulatory surgical centers. Anesthesia benefits are covered for outpatient surgeries. Physician's office visits are covered if medically necessary due to injury or sickness. It also details inpatient and outpatient diagnostic radiology and imaging benefits, specifying conditions for coverage. Inpatient and outpatient laboratory test benefits are outlined, with conditions for coverage.

title: Group Accident Benefits Overview
summary: This page outlines the benefits available under a group accident policy, including Hospital Admission, Daily Hospital Confinement, and Daily Intensive Care/Coronary Care Unit benefits. It explains the conditions under which these benefits are paid, such as medical necessity and policy coverage dates. Additionally, it covers Daily Physician's Office Visits, Emergency Room Visits for Sickness and Injury, and Anesthesia Benefits for both inpatient and outpatient surgeries. Each section specifies the eligibility criteria and the circumstances leading to the termination of benefit payments.

title: Group Accident Description of Benefits
summary: This page outlines the benefits provided under a group accident insurance plan for various medical services. It includes details on Daily Inpatient and Outpatient Surgery Benefits, specifying conditions under which a covered person can claim these benefits. The document also discusses Daily Inpatient and Outpatient Diagnostic Radiology, X-ray, and Imaging Benefits, explaining the eligibility criteria for receiving these services. Additionally, it describes Daily Inpatient and Outpatient Laboratory Test Benefits, outlining the requirements for coverage of laboratory tests.

title: Group Hospital Fixed Indemnity Benefit Exclusions
summary: This page outlines the exclusions of the Limited Fixed Indemnity insurance portion of the membership. It lists circumstances under which the insurance does not cover losses, including self-inflicted injuries, war, illegal acts, substance abuse, and certain medical treatments. Specific exclusions involve treatments related to mental illness, substance abuse, experimental drugs, pregnancy, elective abortion, and more. Services rendered by non-approved medical personnel or in specific federal facilities are also excluded.

title: Group Hospital Fixed Indemnity Benefit Exclusions Continued
summary: This page outlines additional exclusions to the group hospital fixed indemnity benefits. Exclusions include treatment related to blood or plasma, routine vision care, accidents involving unlicensed motor vehicle operation, and various travel-related scenarios. It also mentions exclusions for rest cures, custodial care, certain prescriptions, elective or cosmetic surgery, and physiotherapy services. Additionally, there is a limitation on coverage for pre-existing conditions, which are not covered for the first 12 months after the coverage start date. The insurance is described as a limited policy, not intended to replace comprehensive medical insurance or provide major medical coverage.

title: Group Accident Benefit Exclusions
summary: This page outlines various exclusions under a Group Accident Benefit Certificate. It lists specific conditions and scenarios where losses are not covered, such as self-inflicted injuries, participation in illegal activities, injuries sustained during military service, and medical conditions like heart attacks or pregnancy-related issues. The document specifies that injuries resulting from intoxication, drug use, and other specified medical treatments are also excluded from coverage.

title: Group Accident Benefit Exclusions (Continued)
summary: This page outlines specific exclusions related to group accident benefits. It lists various conditions and scenarios where benefits are not payable, such as treatments for temporomandibular joint disorders, dental care not related to accidents, and certain blood treatments. It also excludes coverage for eyewear, hearing aids, certain motor vehicle accidents, and specific travel situations. Additional exclusions include participation in professional sports, replacement of prosthetic devices, cosmetic surgeries, and rest cures. The document emphasizes that this insurance provides limited benefits and is not a substitute for comprehensive medical coverage.

title: Termination of Insurance Policies
summary: This page outlines the conditions under which different types of insurance coverage terminate. It includes information on the termination of the policyholder's insurance, the insured person's termination, and the dependent's termination. The policy terminates automatically on the policy expiration date or if premiums are not paid. Insurance for an insured person ends on the earliest of specified conditions such as not being in an eligible class, reporting for military duty, or request by the insured person. A dependent's insurance ends when the policy terminates, their coverage ends, they are no longer a dependent, or the premium period ends. Additionally, there is information about the insurance premium related to coverage underwritten by the United States Fire Insurance Company, detailing various premium rates for different coverage levels.

title: NCE Association Membership Overview
summary: This page provides information about the National Congress of Employers (NCE), highlighting its role in supporting small and medium-sized businesses with services and resources. It discusses membership benefits, including non-insurance offerings and insurance enrollment for individuals and families. Details about the membership packet, ID cards, and the Premier Plan's insured benefits are provided. The plan offers limited accident-only insurance, emphasizing the terms and conditions of coverage. Additionally, the page outlines insurance eligibility criteria for members under age 65 and their dependents.

title: NCE Association Membership Benefits Overview
summary: This page outlines the benefits provided by the NCE Association membership, including no waiting periods or pre-existing condition limitations for services such as medical, pharmacy, vision, dental, hearing, and alternative care. The GapAfford Plus program offers savings on medical expenses with no limits on usage, deductibles, medical exams, or age restrictions. Members can access pre-negotiated, lowered rates. The First Health Network provides discounts by re-pricing claims to reduce out-of-pocket costs. Services are available nationwide, covering doctors, hospitals, clinics, and labs.

title: NCE Association Membership Benefits - GapAfford Plus Overview
summary: This page provides an overview of the benefits available through the GapAfford Plus program. It covers various health-related services and discounts, including prescription drug benefits, dental network access, vision network savings, and hearing savings. Additional services include imaging savings, chiropractic care, medical bill negotiations, and access to medical supplies and equipment. The page also highlights the Laboratory Savings Program, physical therapy discounts, and savings on vitamins and supplements. Furthermore, it offers information on 24/7 health information and nurse help lines.
